intro: Sisymbrium castellanosii, commonly known as the Castellanos' winter cress, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many cruciferous species. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and produces small, yellow flowers in early spring. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it has a short life cycle, often completing its growth within a single growing season. Sisymbrium castellanosii is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in arid environments.
